title: Janet Jackson is bundled up against the cold as she touches down in New York City's JFK airport
text:
She spent the previous month celebrating the 30th anniversary of her iconic album Rhythm Nation 1814.

Janet Jackson was spotted Saturday at JFK airport in New York City as her flight touched down.

The 53–year–old singer was bundled up in a puffy jacket as she arrived in the midst of a chilly day.

Back in town: Janet Jackson, 53, was spotted Saturday at JFK airport in New York City as her flight touched down

Janet's golden brown down jacket was left unzipped and matched the color of her long, tightly curled locks.

The Nasty singer wore a baggy black hoodie and sweat pants with long drawstrings underneath, which she matched with a pair of black platform sneakers.

Her hair was covered up with a black beanie, and she went incognito with a black pair of aviator sunglasses.

Missing from Janet's trip was her two–year–old son Eissa Al Mana, whom she shares with her ex-husband, Qatari businessman Wissam Al Mana.

Low-key style: Janet had on a golden brown down jacket over a baggy black hoodie and sweat pants

Janet was seen in mid-September wearing a wrist brace, though she appeared to have recovered from her injury by now.

She's had a busy year of touring, which included a spate of shows for her Las Vegas residency and a summer tour of Europe.

The hitmaker also courted controversy when she filled in for Nicki Minaj for a concert in Saudi Arabia.

Other musicians had boycotted the Jeddah World Music Festival due to the country's history of human rights violations and the recent assassination of Washington Post columnist Jamal Khashoggi.

The Saudi Arabian dissident was killed in the Saudi Arabian consulate in Istanbul, Turkey, in October 2018. The CIA has since concluded that Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman ordered his kidnapping and killing.

Back in black: She matched her outfit with a pair of black platform sneakers and a black beanie

Triumphant return: Janet played Vegas residency dates and a European tour this summer. She returned to Minneapolis, where she recorded 1986's Control through 2001's All For You; pictured in 2018

Last month, Janet returned to Minneapolis, Minnesota, where she recorded her acclaimed string of chart-topping albums from 1986's Control to 2001's All For You.

While speaking to the Minnesota Star Tribune, the singer confessed that she 'absolutely loves' motherhood and that motherhood has had a positive impact on her.

'It’s definitely changed me for the better. Everyone always said how patient a person I was,' she said.

'But I found a whole new world within myself when it comes to patience and having someone that relies on me to care for. It’s the first thing on my mind and the last thing on my mind.'

Solo flight: Missing from her plane trip was her two-year-old son Eissa, whom she shares with ex-husband Wissam Al Mana; pictured together in 2013

The fact that Eissa has avoided the 'terrible twos' probably didn't hurt her ability to be patient.

'What’s terrible about it? They’re growing up, they’re exploring, they’re discovering, they’re walking into their independence. There’s nothing terrible to me about that,' she continued.

'They talk about the tantrums. Eissa hasn’t served me with that. So, I’m thankful.'

Trouble in paradise: Janet and Wissam married in 2012, but they clashed over his conservative beliefs, which required her to wear baggy clothing and cut out sexual references in her music; pictured in 2015

Janet met Eissa's father Wissam in 2010, and the couple quickly hit it off.

The two got engaged in 2012 and had a private wedding that's believed to have taken place in Dubai shortly afterward.

However, the couple reportedly clashed over Wissam's more conservative beliefs. During their marriage, Janet took to wearing more modest, flowing outfits, while cutting out raunchier dance numbers from her live shows, reportedly at her husband's behest.

She also removed any lyrics featuring the word 'sex' from her 2015 album Unbreakable.

Their son was born in January 2017, but by April the couple announced they were separating and seeking a divorce.

Now that she's back on the road, Janet's upcoming tour dates will take her to Australia, New Zealand and Hawaii.
description: Janet Jackson touched down at JFK airport in New York City wearing a puffy down jacket and loose sweats. Missing from the trip was her two-year-old son Eissa Al Mana.
